author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In U.S., so much shouting, I doth fear,
My cup of ale trembles with such uproar!
For Ukraine's aid they spar, both near and far,
Yet domestic squabbles block the door.

A change in rates doth stir the market's sea,
Bond prices sink, Seven Mighty, in distress.
With brewing storm, my wine doth taste less sweet,
Emerging markets feeling the duress.

Congress, once locked, now finds a sudden key,
Their house averted closure in surprise.
But, ah, no aid for Ukraine in their purse,
And guards for borders, they did not devise.

feedItems.title: In U.S. Fights Over Ukraine Aid, Allies Fear Deeper Global Harm
feedItems.description: Washington has led the response to Russia, but domestic political spats are raising worries about U.S. commitment.

feedItems.title: A New Interest-Rate Regime Has Begun. These Are the Market's Winners and Losers.
feedItems.description: Bond prices, the Magnificent Seven and emerging markets are under pressure.

feedItems.title: Congress Averts Shutdown in Surprise Breakthrough
feedItems.description: The measure passed by the House and Senate includes $16 billion in disaster relief but omits aid for Ukraine and excludes border-security measures sought by Republicans.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In China's realm, a realm quite vast,
A crisis brews, the die is cast.
Four charts tell tales of woe and fright;
The snail, in shadow, seeks the light.

A will in place, yet still it errs,
The rabbit's path, confusion blurs.
Goats know, if forms are neatly penned,
Your true desire - the rightful end.

Stellantis strides, its leader bold,
The dog, head high, in tales of old.
Union and master, dance entwined;
No strikes today, a pact they find.

feedItems.title: Does China's Property Bust Make a Financial Crisis Inevitable?
feedItems.description: Perhaps not—if Beijing plays its cards right. But serious damage to the nation’s prospects is still likely. A look at the problem in five charts.

feedItems.title: Your Will Alone Won't Guarantee Your Money Goes to Your Heirs
feedItems.description: Those beneficiary forms you filled out years ago can supersede your other estate plans.

feedItems.title: How Stellantis and Its Not-So-Detroit CEO Are Taking On the UAW
feedItems.description: The company and boss Carlos Tavares—both more European than American—are making progress with the union and avoiding more strikes for now.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Michigan wild, where forests grow dense,
Biden and Trump with the union commence,
Their words, like songs, serenade the throng,
Yet costly contracts do to makers belong.

Upon the morrow, to the college we sail,
Where wisdom’s bloom renders fortunes hale.
An institution famed, its triumph unmatched,
Creating wealth, with knowledge latched.

Then comes the twilight of TV's reign,
The peak of its glory begins to wane.
Though Hollywood’s dusk draws near and nearer,
In our hearts, its flame burns ever clearer.

feedItems.title: Biden and Trump Woo the UAW in Michigan
feedItems.description: A study of U.S. manufacturing decline shows the risks of too-costly union contracts.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The top college in America for making graduates richer

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The era of peak TV is officially over—and Hollywood will never be the same

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the grand court of the Ryder Cup, tempers aflame,
Dramatic day's end found no heroes to tame.
Long putt for American might, a victory claimed,
In the heat of battle, none left unmaimed.

In the land of Washington, brink of close call,
Polarization, a tempest, threatens to befall.
Held firm by the rebels, the GOP's stand,
Against the Democrat tide, like sea against sand.

Hearken to the expert, in long-distance stride,
A course 'gainst injury, he doth provide.
Marathon warriors, their miles to increase,
In the workout of safety, their pains to cease.

feedItems.title: Dramatic Day Ends in Fiery Altercations at the Ryder Cup
feedItems.description: Heated arguments, tears and a long putt to win a match for the Americans produced fireworks on the second day of the U.S. vs. Europe competition.

feedItems.title: How Polarization Sent Washington to the Brink of a Shutdown
feedItems.description: GOP rebels, fueled by social media and online fundraising, feel empowered to block their leaders from cutting deals with Democrats.

feedItems.title: A Workout to Help Runners Increase Miles and Avoid Injury
feedItems.description: A long-distance expert offers advice to stay on course during training for marathon season.
